content: Let's get to know each other better! Don't be shy, introduce yourself. Are you TTC for baby #1? Baby #2 or #3? How long have you and your partner been trying?

comments.content: My name is Marissa, and I am the mother to 3 beautiful daughters. My husband, and I have never TTC until now. All my girls where a surprise. I had a miscarriage between my oldest and middle daughter, and also had another early this year. We have been trying since July for our 4th baby with no luck. We have even quit trying just letting it happen.

Hello, New TTC 2 months. I eat poorly & suffer from insomnia, my fiancé tries to help me eat healthy but fast food is my addiction (I'm not overweight). My body is constantly exhausted, what could I do to help eat healthy & get more rest without taking pills?
Hi! TTC for just two months, but I have endometriosis. Anyone else?

Hi everyone! I am 27 years old and trying to conceive with my Fiancé. In July of this year I found out I was pregnant with my first child. 6 days later I was hospitalized for an ectopic pregnancy. I needed emergency surgery to remove the ectopic and was told that my right Fallopian tube was abnormal and my chances of fertility would be lessened by it. 
We are now trying to conceive again. 

You see the most frustrating part in all this is that I donated my eggs several years ago to couples who wanted to have children. I never thought I would find anyone to have children with. Now that I have found my Prince Charming, these difficulties have occurred. 

I am glad to be here, connecting with others who are trying to conceive.
Hello everyone

Hey all. I'm Jessica, 37, and will be married to my amazing DH for 5 years on Dec. 19th. We have a 3 year old son and have been TTC baby #2 for about 2 years now. I have issues with veeeery light AF that has come every 24-26 days for the past year. I dropped about 20 lbs and had 2 regular flow AF's in a row. This month I am later than usual with my AF. I was on CD 31 today, cramping, etc. POAS and got a BFN, then after church I ended up spotting, so I'm assuming I started and will try again next month. I feel like I don't know when anything is going on in my cycle, so it's time to get serious about charting. I am glad to meet y'all and hope we can all support each other along on our journeys. :)

Hi everyone! My boyfriend and I have been together now for almost 7 years and are finally TLC baby #1! I recently had a surgery to remove an ovarian cyst where they also had to remove one of my Fallopian tubes. Any advice from the ladies that have PCOS? Good luck to all the families new and growing!

Hello, new to this whole thing. Been with my husband for 10years (married one). We haven't ever really been TTC, but we weren't actively preventing it either. It was more of "if it happens fine, but let's be cautious." Now (me at 30, he at 35) we're ready to add to his two from previous relationships, but i'm concerned that I may not be able to "perform" since I never conceived after all these years with no BC or protection. Please sprinkle baby dust and well wishes our way. Blessings and prayers to everyone trying to conceive.
I have irregular periods as well. Same time frame too. Husband and I have been trying for about two and a half years. Got pregnant this time last year but miscarried very early. Keeping positive!
I have been working on baby #2 for 2 years. I have a 14 year old son. So far no luck for baby #2
Same here. I've been ttc for 2 years now! Any advices ?!
Hi all! I'm Kaitlyn, 23 and married to my wonderful husband Danny, 34. We've been trying for baby #1 for two years now. Hoping to get my miracle soon!! ♥

Hello! I suffered a miscarriage with what would have been our first child in January of this year and have been trying to conceive again since April. It's been very frustrating (since we conceived six weeks after going off birth control the first time) but we are staying positive! Recently discovered I have a gluten intolerance that con contibute to miscarriages and difficulty conceiving so trying hard to eat healthy and take care of myself. Good luck to all you ladies out there!

Hey everyone! My husband and I have been ttc for baby number 1 for 7 years now... As frustrating and saddening it can be. We have Faith that it'll happen. Good luck to everyone who is in the same boat as we are .
But to add to accupuncture it was my 1st cycle with clomid .. Hoping for the best

Hi everyone! My husband and I are ttc baby #1. It has been over 3 years and I'm hoping this app helps. I'm feeling down and broken as a woman. We want a baby so badly :( hope this app can do the trick!

Hello everyone! 
I've been married for a year and a half in December. We are ttc baby# 2, we've been trying for 3 months! I'm excited to add to our family.

content: Neural tube defects develop in the first 28 days after conception, before many women know they are pregnant. Some studies also show that folic acid also may help prevent heart defects in a baby and birth defects in a baby’s mouth called cleft lip and palate.

comments.content: We were trying for 3 years. taking vitex. I broke down at the 3 year mark and told my husband that I'm done trying and cried my eyes out. the next day I felt better and I obviously wasn't going to give up. I just needed to have that big let out of feelings. I also lost 10lbs. the month after I was able to conceive. I'm not saying to relax and/or quit cause you can't quit something you want so desperately. just maybe have a really good vent and cry with a trusted friend. :) you will feel better emotionally and you will cleanse your body of tensions and stresses. :) I hope it helps.

The EWG is not as great a source as they may seem. The biggest flaw I've seen is that they list individual ingredients as hazardous, without taking into account how ingredients interact with each other. For example, sodium and chlorine are both very unsafe on their own. But when combined chemically, they make sodium chloride aka table salt. ​
​http://chemistscorner.com/3-reasons-the-ewg-is-dubious-resource/

content: Wet, Lather, Scrub, Rinse, and Dry. Regular hand-washing is like a "do-it-yourself" vaccine—it involves five simple and effective steps to reduce the spread of germs, like diarrhea and respiratory illness, so you can stay healthy.

comments.content: Washing frequently with regular soap is okay.  Just make sure to keep your hands moisturized.  However, avoid the use of triclosan containing anti-bacterial soaps, you're actually lowering your defenses because it's wiping out both good and bad bacteria.
It is just like anything in this world! Moderation is key cause you can overdo anything!!
Yea, its very neccessary. I do it every time and i have got used to it now. Thanks for the information

Over washing while using anti-bacterial hand soap and over use of anti-bacterial hand sanitizer actually makes you more susceptible to colds and other common illnesses as your body can't fight off the bugs as well. Remember to play hard and get dirty, don't worry too much about germs as many are beneficial to you! Don't over do it on the Lysol and hand sanitizer, you'll be just fine!

title: Protect yourself from infection by washing your hands frequently with soap and water.

content: Up to 80% of women experience PMS and soy can serve as a nutritional therapy to help alleviate symptoms. Eating soy was shown to reduce the severity of physical symptoms such as headache, cramps, and breast tenderness; scientists speculate that soy works because it balances estrogen levels.

comments.content: I thought symptoms related to PMS and your period were caused by a drop in PROGESTERONE, not estrogen.  That's why soy helps menopausal women if anything.  By the way, a little FERNENTED soy (miso, tempeh, natto) is good for you because fermentation minimizes the bad compounds like phytic acid and maximizes bioavailability of the good stuff.  What people need to do is stay away from highly processed, UNfermented soy products like TVP and Soymilk and minimize traditional UNfermented soy products like tofu.
**soy

content: To detect skin cancer early, examine your skin all over your body and watch for changes over time. By checking your skin regularly, you'll learn what is normal for you.

This is great advice thank you!!
Color should be uniform. Diameter-anything larger than approx a pencil eraser should get checked as well as raised moles
Asymmetry, draw an imaginary line thru center. Should be even. Border should be defined and clean not jagged or blurry.
ABCDE's a-asymmetry, b-border, c-color, d-diameter, e-elevation. Stay healthy xoxo
if there is hair growing from them you should get them checked

ABCDs :)
Border, Color changes, Depth changes
Asymmetrical

content: Once the LH surge has occurred, ovulation usually takes place within 12 to 36 hours. There is an 80% chance of detecting ovulation with five days of testing, and a 95% chance with 10 days of testing. Once ovulation is documented, it is no longer necessary to continue testing during that cycle. Occasionally, ovulation may not occur in a particular cycle. If ovulation is not detected in two or more consecutive cycles, an ovulatory problem may be present.

comments.content: Took the first one on 2 days ago and took the second one yesterday. Ovulating?

It's the same problem with everything "low-fat". People tend to drink/eat way more than "whole", because it's "light". But the calories keep stacking up.​Everything in moderation is the key.
Im allergic to milk so I use almond milk.
I've also heard that switching to full fat milk makes you more fertile too.
Where can we find this study? I drink milk a ton, so I'm intrigued...
I am too but I drink almond milk.
I'm lactose intolerant but I do drink lactaid

title: If you drink milk in moderation, switch to whole milk.
